algorithm.title: About Algorithm v6.0
algorithm.subtitle: Enhanced ranking system with innovation decay, platform risk modifiers, and revenue quality adjustments
algorithm.description: Our ranking algorithm combines quantitative metrics with qualitative assessments to provide a comprehensive view of AI coding tools. We update rankings weekly based on new data and continuously refine our methodology.

modifiers.decay: Innovation Decay (6-month half-life) - Ensures recent innovations are weighted more heavily
modifiers.risk: Platform Risk Modifier - Adjusts scores based on platform dependencies and lock-in
modifiers.revenue: Revenue Quality Adjustment - Differentiates between sustainable and one-time revenue

algorithm.methodologyText: Our comprehensive methodology evaluates AI coding tools across multiple dimensions, ensuring fair and accurate rankings that reflect real-world performance and adoption.

methodology.title: Our Methodology
methodology.subtitle: How we rank AI coding tools
methodology.intro: AI Power Ranking uses a sophisticated algorithm (v6.0) to evaluate and rank AI coding tools based on multiple quantitative and qualitative factors. Our methodology is designed to provide developers with an objective, data-driven assessment of the AI tools landscape.

algorithm.title: Algorithm v6.0
algorithm.description: Our latest ranking algorithm incorporates real-world usage patterns and market dynamics

features.innovationDecay: Innovation decay modeling to reflect tool freshness
features.platformRisk: Platform risk assessment for vendor dependencies
features.revenueQuality: Revenue quality adjustments based on business model
features.technicalWeighting: Technical capability weighting for different use cases

factors.title: Scoring Factors
factors.description: Tools are evaluated across 8 key dimensions with specific weightings

agentic.details: Measures autonomous capabilities, multi-step reasoning, and complex task completion

innovation.details: Evaluates breakthrough features, technical advances, and market differentiation

performance.details: Benchmarks on SWE-bench, HumanEval, and real-world coding tasks

adoption.details: Active users, growth rate, and market penetration metrics

traction.details: Revenue growth, funding rounds, and business momentum indicators

sentiment.details: Developer satisfaction, community feedback, and recommendation scores

velocity.details: Feature release cadence, update frequency, and innovation speed

resilience.details: Platform stability, backup options, and vendor independence

modifiers.title: Dynamic Modifiers
modifiers.description: Real-time adjustments that reflect market conditions and tool maturity

innovationDecay.description: Innovation scores decay over time to reward continuous improvement and penalize stagnation

platformRisk.description: Adjustments based on vendor lock-in, platform dependencies, and business risks

revenueQuality.description: Revenue weighting based on business model sustainability and growth potential

dataSources.title: Data Sources & Validation
dataSources.description: We maintain rigorous standards for data collection and validation

sources.api: Direct API integrations with tool providers
sources.research: Industry research reports and analyst data
sources.announcements: Official company announcements and press releases

requirements.completeness: All required metrics must be present
requirements.reliability: Multiple source verification for key metrics

updateFrequency.title: Update Schedule
updateFrequency.description: Rankings are recalculated weekly with continuous data collection. Major algorithm updates are versioned and documented.

scoringFactors.title: Scoring Factors
scoringFactors.intro: Our algorithm evaluates tools across 8 key dimensions, each weighted according to its importance to developers:

modifiers.intro: To ensure rankings reflect current market realities, we apply three sophisticated modifiers:

updateFrequency.title: Update Frequency
updateFrequency.content: Rankings are recalculated weekly to reflect the rapidly evolving AI landscape. Major methodology updates are versioned and documented.

about.title: About AI Power Ranking
about.subtitle: Empowering developers with data-driven AI tool insights

hero.title: Empowering developers with data-driven AI tool insights
hero.subtitle: We believe developers deserve transparent, objective rankings of AI coding tools to make informed decisions.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To provide the developer community with the most comprehensive, unbiased, and up-to-date rankings of AI coding tools, helping teams choose the right tools for their needs.
mission.description: To provide the developer community with the most comprehensive, unbiased, and up-to-date rankings of AI coding tools, helping teams choose the right tools for their needs.

whyWeBuiltThis.title: Why We Built This
reasons: The AI tools landscape is evolving rapidly, making it hard to keep track
Marketing claims often don't match real-world performance
Developers need objective data to justify tool adoption
There was no single source comparing all major AI coding tools

team.title: The Team
team.description: AI Power Ranking is maintained by Bob Matsuoka, a technology executive and fractional CTO who's been tracking agentic coding tools since March 2025.
team.description1: AI Power Ranking is maintained by Bob Matsuoka, a technology executive and fractional CTO who's been tracking agentic coding tools since March 2025.
team.description2: I combine hands-on experience building production applications with systematic evaluation of AI development tools. This site provides the quantitative backbone for my strategic analysis at HyperDev, where I write about the practical realities of coding with AI agents.
team.description3: Full transparency: this is a one-person operation built in two days. I'm shipping and iterating based on real usage because the developer tools landscape moves too fast for traditional analysis cycles.

whyItMatters.title: Why It Matters
whyItMatters.description: In the rapidly evolving AI landscape, developers need reliable data to make informed decisions.
points: Choose tools that fit your needs

paralysis.title: Decision Paralysis
paralysis.description: With dozens of AI tools launching every week, developers face overwhelming choices

marketing.title: Marketing vs Reality
marketing.description: Bold claims often don't match real-world performance and capabilities

change.title: Rapid Change
change.description: Tools evolve quickly - what's best today might be obsolete tomorrow

risks.title: Hidden Risks
risks.description: Security, privacy, and vendor lock-in concerns are often overlooked

whyItMatters.conclusion: That's why we built AI Power Ranking - to cut through the noise and provide clear, data-driven insights.
